pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we give a concrete characterization of limit multiforks in the category of types.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

---

This is used in #14208

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9828055220/job/27131472930)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9828055220/job/27131472836)

```suggestion
  toFun s :=
  { val := fun i â†¦ match i with
      | .left i => s.val i
      | .right j => I.fst j (s.val _)
    property := by
      rintro _ _ (_|_|r)
      Â· rfl
      Â· rfl
      Â· exact (s.property r).symm }
  invFun s :=
  { val := fun i â†¦ s.val (.left i)
    property := fun r â†¦ (s.property (.fst r)).trans (s.property (.snd r)).symm }
```
I don't know if we have a rule for this, feel free to ignore. I just think it looks slightly better this way.
Thanks for the reviews! but I do not think that we have any precise rule for `{...}`!

```suggestion
functor `I.multicospan`. -/
```
Also I'd call `I.multicospan` the diagram and `I : MulticospanIndex (Type u)` the index of that diagram.
Thanks! I have changed the phrasing.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: API for multiequalizers in the category of types

source.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry): representability by a scheme is a local property
